metadata.title: CVE-2022-39189 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered the x86 KVM subsystem in the Linux kernel before5.18.17. Unprivileged guest users can compromise the guest kernel becauseTLB flush operations are mishandled in certain KVM_VCPU_PREEMPTEDsituations.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-39189` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-50-generic - 5.15.0-50.56~20.04.1
linux-image-5.15.0-50-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-50.56~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-50-generic - 5.15.0-50.56~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-50-generic-64k - 5.15.0-50.56~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1021-aws - 5.15.0-1021.25~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1021-azure - 5.15.0-1021.26~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1021-gcp - 5.15.0-1021.28~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1019-gke - 5.15.0-1019.23~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1017-intel-iotg - 5.15.0-1017.22~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-50-lowlatency - 5.15.0-50.56~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-50-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-50.56~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1019-oracle - 5.15.0-1019.24~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1019-azure-fde - 5.15.0-1021.26~20.04.1
No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1033-ibm - 5.15.0-1033.36~20.04.1
No subscription required
